January 21st, 2014

Cutting Simple Assets From Photoshop

This is a quick way to cut assets out of a PSD when you don’t need to slice specific sections of an image contained in a layer. Once you’re comfortable with the process and the keyboard shortcuts, you’ll be able to cut out an asset in less than a minute.

January 9th, 2013

Base z-index using SASS

I’m developing an application for a client in the form of overlays on top of their existing content. Today, I was informed that our z-indexes are all too low. The client’s site has elements that can go all the way up to 3000, and our elements were definitely below that. They recommended we use a minimum of 4000 to be safe.
